text: Hello all! Is it somehow possible to turn a Pluto notebook into a fully interactive webpage to put on a website? Somewhere where the user could just manipulate sliders and change plots and parameters in a simulation. If possible, all on code running client-side with no servers?

text: yes. plotly allows zooming and panning, But the sliders will not update the plots. That would essentially required the julia to be compiled into webassembly or something like that. But even that would be tricky. Imagine you have a dropdown or slider which causes julia to load different CSVs. in order to “package” that, pluto would have to figure out all possible CSVs and then put the CSVs into the webpage. Easier: just put everything on github. Then anyone can run it by installing julia,  instantiating the environment and running pluto.
